title: 3 Ways to Find Your Phone Number on a Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your Galaxy phone or tablet .
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your Galaxy phone or tablet . Tap the Settings app in your list of apps. It generally has an icon that resembles a gear. [1] X Research source Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen and tap the gear in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap About phone.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap About phone . This may say "About device." [2] X Research source If your Settings menu has headings at the top, tap the More tab.

steps.title: Find your phone number.
steps.content: Find your phone number. Your phone number appears at the top of the page next to "Phone Number" or "My phone number." If you don't see it, tap Status or SIM status . If your number is showing as "Unknown" or is incorrect, see Fixing a Missing Phone Number to fix it. You can also find your phone number in your Contacts .

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. You'll find it in your Apps list. It has an icon with a person on it. [3] X Research source Alternatively, you can open the Phone app and tap the Contacts tab at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap your name.
steps.content: Tap your name. It's at the top of the page below your profile image if you have set one. You can also tap your profile image. If you are viewing your contacts through the Phone app, tap your name below the "Me" label at the top.

steps.title: Scroll down and view your number.
steps.content: Scroll down and view your number. It's listed below "Mobile" near the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. It has an icon that resembles a person on it, and you'll find it in your Apps list. [4] X Research source Use this method if you know your phone number, but it's not appearing in the "About phone" section of Settings. You can also open Contacts by tapping the Contacts tab in the Phone app.

steps.title: Tap your name.
steps.content: Tap your name. It's at the top of the page below your profile image if you have set one. You can also tap your profile image. If you are viewing your contacts through the Phone app, tap your name below the "Me" label at the top.

steps.title: Tap Edit .
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's the middle tab at the bottom of the screen. It has an icon that resembles a pencil. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap the green plus + button next to "Phone".
steps.content: Scroll down and tap the green plus + button next to "Phone". It's the first option at the top of the section for personal information.

steps.title: Enter your phone number and tap Save.
steps.content: Enter your phone number and tap Save . Use the number pad at the bottom of the screen to enter your full phone number with country and area code. Then, tap SAVE at the top or bottom of the screen, depending on your Galaxy model. [6] X Research source If your phone number is still not appearing or is incorrect in the Settings menu, make sure your SIM card is properly installed.
